intro: Capsella belgica, commonly known as mouse-ear or false flax, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that are arranged in racemes, and its leaves are heart-shaped with a velvety texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in fields. The seeds are small and contained in pods that split open when mature, aiding in seed dispersal.
